alert.note: Alert for Northern and Central Idaho Panhandle (Idaho) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Spokane (Eastern Washington and Northern Idaho)
info.headline: Red Flag Warning issued July 24 at 10:47PM MDT until July 25 at 12:00AM MDT by NWS Spokane
info.description: ...RED FLAG WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 11 PM PDT THIS EVENING FOR THUNDERSTORMS FOR THE IDAHO PANHANDLE AND LOWER PALOUSE... * Affected Area: Fire Weather Zone 101 Northern and Central Idaho Panhandle (Zone 101) and Fire Weather Zone 709 Lower Palouse -Snake River (Zone 709). * Thunderstorms: Abundant lightning may result in new fire starts. * Outflow Winds: Outflow wind gusts up to 30 to 40 MPH may result in fire spread with any new fire starts. * Impacts: Lightning may result in new fire starts. Gusty winds may result in fire spread with any new fire starts.
info.instruction: A Red Flag Warning means that critical fire weather conditions are either occurring now....or will shortly. A combination of strong winds...low relative humidity...and warm temperatures can contribute to extreme fire behavior.
